title: CH4 heating curve - dHvap less for CH4 than H2O

content.description: The following questions refer to the graph below, which shows the heating curve for methane, CH4.
content.question:
The enthalpy of vaporization of water is 
40.7 kJ/mol. Which of the following best 
explains why the enthalpy of vaporization of methane is less than that of water?

choices.label: Methane does not exhibit hydrogen bonding, but water does.
Methane has a smaller molar mass.
Methane has a much lower density.

content.answer: Methane does not exhibit hydrogen bonding, but water does.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
